tileProbability

private double tileProbability(int tilenumber,
                               int drawpurpose,
                               AvailableTilePattern available,
                               int wallsize,
                               int prevplayerhandsize)
This method determines the probability of drawing a tile from the available tile set.

Parameters:
tilenumber - the tile to be drawn
drawpurpose - the reason we're drawing it
available - the available tiles set
wallsize - the size of the wall minus deadwall
prevplayerhandsize - the number of tiles potentially available from the previous player (for chow calculation)
Returns:
the probability that we'll draw a tile for a specific purpose

rank

private double rank(RequiredTilePattern pattern,
                    TilePattern pathpattern,
                    double tilescore,
                    double highesttilepoints,
                    AvailableTilePattern available,
                    int[] hand,
                    int roundwind,
                    int playerwind,
                    int wallsize,
                    int prevplayerhandsize)
This is where the actual ranking of a pattern happens. The rank is a weighed mix of the tilepoints that a winning pattern will generate as winner, and the probability of reaching that winning pattern from the one currently held. The mix is determined by the ratio value which is set when the PatternScorer object is made. The rank formula is (ratio*tilescore) + ((1-ratio)*ranking)) * dampening where the ranking is the probablistic distance to the winning pattern, and the dampening fact is a the value 1/{number of tiles that need to be swapped}.

Parameters:
pattern - the pattern representing which tiles are required to get from this hand to the pathpattern
pathpattern - the pattern that is being considered as play-for pattern
available - the set of potentially available tiles for a player
hand - player's concealed tiles
roundwind - the wind of the round
playerwind - the player's own wind
wallsize - the size of the wall, minus the dead wall
prevplayerhandsize - the number of the previous player, used for determining chow likelihood
Returns:
the rank of this pattern

computeRank

private double computeRank(double tiledistance,
                           double ratio,
                           double tilescore,
                           double highesttilepoints,
                           double probabilisticrank)
computes the rank as a balance between the number of tiles to reach a target pattern, the score this pattern will give, and the likelihood of getting to that pattern given what we know of the state of all gametiles.

Parameters:
tiledistance - the number of tiles required to get to a target pattern
ratio - the weight ratio between pattern tilepoint score, and the probability of getting to that pattern
tilescore - the tilepoint score for the pattern
highesttilepoints - the highest tilepoint score seen for the full set of possible play patterns
probabilisticrank - the probabilistic measure for getting to the pattern
Returns:
the computed rank

scorePatterns

public double[] scorePatterns(RequiredTilePattern[] requiredpatterns,
                              TilePattern[] pathpatterns,
                              AvailableTilePattern available,
                              int[] hand,
                              int roundwind,
                              int playerwind,
                              int wallsize,
                              int prevplayerhandsize)
Analyses each difference pattern and scores it in terms of how easy it is to go for, given that we know that all the tiles in [available] are available

Parameters:
requiredpatterns - the patterns representing which tiles are required to get from this hand to the pathpatterns
pathpatterns - the set of patterns that are to be considered as play-for pattern
available - the set of potentially available tiles for a player
hand - player's concealed tiles
roundwind - the wind of the round
playerwind - the player's own wind
wallsize - the size of the wall, minus the dead wall
prevplayerhandsize - the number of the previous player, used for determining chow likelihood
Returns:
the set of scores corresponding to the pathpatterns
